metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2203 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the WebKitGTK package. An improper input validation issue may lead to a use-after-free vulnerability. This flaw allows attackers with network access to pass specially crafted web content files, causing a denial of service or arbitrary code execution. This CVE exists because of a CVE-2023-28205 security regression for the WebKitGTK package in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.8 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2.

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8 mdeslaur> This CVE is specific to Red Hat's webkitgtk package, Ubuntu is not vulnerable to this issue.

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
